newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian net reserves rise to 11.3 trln roubles.
newsitem.headline: Russian net reserves rise to 11.3 trln roubles.

text.p: Russia's net international reserves rose to 11.3 trillion roubles on April 1 from 6.6 trillion roubles on March 1, the central bank said on Friday.
Reserves since January 1 this year have been calculated at a rate of 5,560 roubles to the dollar, it said in its weekly bulletin. The rouble now trades at around 5,750 to the dollar.
The central bank issued the following data (trillions of roubles):
NOTES - April 1996 data not available. On June 1, 1996, net reserves, calculated at a rate of 4,640 roubles per dollar, were 20 trillion roubles, down from 35.7 trillion on January 1 last year.

Under Russia's $10 billion three-year loan from the International Monetary Fund, the Fund sets performance targets for the budget deficit, net domestic assets -- defined as the monetary base less net currency reserves -- and net reserves.
